definitions: The action or process of taking a sample or samples.
The technique of selecting a representative part of a population for the purpose of inferring characteristics of the whole population.
The process of taking a small amount of something to test or examine it.
The act of trying a small quantity of food or drink to assess its quality.
The act of incorporating a segment of one sound recording into a new recording.
examples: The team is sampling the water quality.
They are sampling opinions from various demographics.
The chef is sampling the new dish.
The DJ is sampling an old funk track.
